Package de.dhbw.ravensburg.zuul.creature

Class Creature

java.lang.Object
de.dhbw.ravensburg.zuul.creature.Creature
Direct Known Subclasses:
Animal, Human
public class Creature
extends java.lang.Object
Class Creature - a creature in an adventure game. A "Creature" can be an "Animal" or an "Human". Creatures have different abilities. They can help or attack the player. "Creature" is the superclasse from "Animal" and "Human".
Version:
23.05.2020
Author:
Moritz Link - Philipp Schneider

  • Constructor Details

    • Creature

      public Creature()
      Create a "Creature". Creature can be a human or an animal. This constructor is used for "Human" and "Animal".

  • Method Details

    • talk

      public void talk​(Inventory inventory, Parser parser)
      * Defines the Dialog between the player and the Creature
      Parameters:
      inventory - The players inventory.
      parser - The parser to check yes and no answers.

    • takeDamage

      public void takeDamage​(int amount)
      Decreases the creatures livepoints by the amount of damage the player can transfer. If the livescore is negativ, it's set to 0. A messeage is printed about the health status of the creature.
      Parameters:
      amount - of damage that is transfered.

    • getPeaceful

      public boolean getPeaceful()
      Returns if the creature is innocent.
      Returns:
      innocent If the creature is innocent.

      Defines if the creature is innocent
      Parameters:
      innocent - If the creature is innocent.

    • setDropItem

      Defines which item the creature will drop when the creature dies.
      Parameters:
      drop - The item the creature drop when it dies.

      public Item getDropItem()
      Returns the item the creature drops.
      Returns:
      drop The item the creature can drop when it dies.

      public int attack()

      Returns:
